subject: Leadership
title: The Psychology of Trust
description: A quick win: understand The Psychology of Trust.

hook.text: A new leader inherits a distrustful team. The last boss broke promises. Trust takes months to build, seconds to break.

buildup.text: Trust has two components: competence (can you deliver?) and character (do you care?). Both must be present to trust.

discovery.text: Zak's research: oxytocin drives trust. It rises when people feel valued and drops when they sense threat or deception.

twist.text: Trust is asymmetric. One betrayal erases years of reliability. The brain weighs negative signals far more than positive.

climax.text: Build trust daily: keep small promises, be consistent, and admit mistakes fast. Trust is a habit, not a grand gesture.

punchline.text: Trust arrives on foot and leaves on horseback.

quiz.question: What are the two components of trust?
